intro: Hieracium piliferum subsp. hololeptum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are hairy and often have a reddish or purplish hue, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an annual or biennial plant, known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
